result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marie J Bentley

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:49 PM Defendant Marie J Bentley appeared by video.  Attorney Emily Nelson in court for State of Wisconsin.   PD Kaitlin Dippolito appeared in person from PD office.  Matter set for INIT.   PD office unable to locate an attorney as of this date.  Matter adj. to 11/29/22 at 1:30 PM.    DE should continue to call PD office about an attorney  Adj. 1:50 PM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
OSPD Report-to date 178 attempts have been made to obtain counsel.

Absolute sobriety, No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No controlled substances unless prescribed to defendant and then to be taken only as prescribed.

1:22 PM Defendant Marie J Bentley appeared by video.  Attorney Ellen Anderson appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  State PD Dustin Rockow appeared via video.   Matter set for Bail/Bond hearing.  State argued for a $500 cash bond with conditions No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No controlled substances unless prescribed to defendant and then to be taken only as prescribed.  State recited all of DE pending case numbers.  Attorney Rockow argued for a low cash bond and will abide by the nonmonetary conditions and attend all future court appearances. Attorney Emily Nelson appeared for Attorney Anderson who appea Court ORDERED a $1000 cash bond with conditions of absolute sobriety, No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No controlled substances unless prescribed to defendant and then to be taken only as prescribed.  INIT 11/1/22 at 1:30 PM.  Adj. 1:31 PM
